comments:
use the refactoring "Introduce Paramater" in the outlined section below, 
Ideally it should ask you for which method the parameter should be introduced 
for method2 or for methodI, at the moment it fails:
------------------------------------------------------------------------
public class Test
{
   private int m_var = 4;
   
   public void method()
   {
      method2();
   }
   
   public void method2()
   {
      final I x = new I()
      {
         public void methodI()
         {
            int x = m_var + 3; //<-- introduce m_var as parameter!
            System.out.println(x);
         }
      };
      
   }
}
interface I
{
   void methodI();
}
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

with a popup and the following exception:
